perturbation.original_text: The initial term of this Agreement shall be the sooner of six (6) months from the Effective Date, or replacement of this Agreement with a subsequent agreement between the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: The initial term of this Agreement shall be the sooner of six (6) months from the Effective Date, or replacement of this Agreement with a subsequent understanding between the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The use of 'agreement' and 'understanding' interchangeably creates uncertainty. An 'understanding' might not have the same legal enforceability as a formal 'agreement', leading to disputes about the contract's duration and renewal.

perturbation.original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement, with or without cause, upon giving the other party thirty (30) days prior written notice of such termination pursuant to Section 12.7 of this Agreement. The Company may terminate this Agreement immediately and without prior notice if Consultant refuses to or is unable to perform the Services or is in breach of any material provision of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement, with or without cause, upon giving the other party thirty (30) days prior written notification of such termination pursuant to Section 12.7 of this Agreement. The Company may terminate this Agreement immediately and without prior notice if Consultant refuses to or is unable to perform the Services or is in breach of any material provision of this contract.
perturbation.explanation: Using 'notice' and 'notification' interchangeably in the context of termination introduces ambiguity. While seemingly similar, a 'notice' might imply a more formal or legally binding communication compared to a 'notification.' Similarly, the use of the words 'agreement' and 'contract' interchangeably adds further ambiguity. This could lead to disputes regarding the validity of termination depending on how each term is interpreted.

perturbation.original_text: Consultant agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company and its affiliates and subsidiaries and their respective directors, officers and employees from and against all taxes, losses, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including attorneys' fees and other legal expenses, arising directly or indirectly from or in connection with (i) any negligent, reckless or intentionally wrongful act of Consultant or Consultant's assistants, employees, contractors or agents, (ii) performance of the Services or any breach by the Consultant or Consultant's assistants, employees, contractors or agents of any of the covenants contained in this Agreement, (iii) any failure of Consultant to perform the Services in accordance with all applicable laws, rules and regulations, (iv) any violation or claimed violation of a third party's rights resulting in whole or in part from the Company's use of the Inventions or other deliverables of Consultant under this Agreement, or (v) any amounts Company is required to pay by any court or governmental authority in any country based on a finding that Consultant's employees or contractors engaged in the performance of the Services are employees of Company or the failure of Consultant to file documents with respect to such employees or contractors or to pay any tax or similar fee or assessment in any country.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultant agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company and its affiliates and subsidiaries and their respective directors, officers and employees from and against all taxes, losses, damages, responsibilities, costs and expenses, including lawyers' fees and other legal expenses, arising directly or indirectly from or in connection with (i) any negligent, reckless or intentionally wrongful act of Consultant or Consultant's assistants, employees, contractors or representatives, (ii) performance of the Services or any breach by the Consultant or Consultant's assistants, employees, contractors or agents of any of the covenants contained in this contract, (iii) any failure of Consultant to perform the Services in accordance with all applicable laws, rules and ordinances, (iv) any violation or claimed violation of a third party's rights resulting in whole or in part from the Company's use of the Inventions or other deliverables of Consultant under this Understanding, or (v) any amounts Company is required to pay by any court or governmental authority in any country based on a finding that Consultant's employees or contractors engaged in the performance of the Services are employees of Company or the failure of Consultant to file documents with respect to such employees or contractors or to pay any tax or similar fee or assessment in any country.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'liabilities' to 'responsibilities' shifts the legal weight, as responsibilities are less forceful than liabilities. The subtle alteration from 'attorneys' fees' to 'lawyers' fees' could cause confusion. Replacing 'agents' with 'representatives' in the first clause dilutes the legal accountability. Referring to the overall agreement as a 'contract' in one clause and 'understanding' in another fundamentally changes the scope of legal recourse. Finally, replacing 'regulations' with 'ordinances' limits the potential issues covered.
